lines.text: You know, it strikes me that we would be better employed wringing Milady's pretty neck than shooting these poor devils of Protestants. I mean, what are we killing them for? Because they sing psalms in French and we sing them in Latin?
Porthos, have you no education? What do you think religious wars are all about?

[reciting from memory the letter Richelieu wrote giving Milady de Winter permission to kill Buckingham, d'Artagnan and Constance, as Richelieu reads the actual note which D'Artagnan has handed him]
"By my order and for the good of the state, the bearer has done what has been done."
Hm. One should be careful what one writes...
[he tears up the note]
and to whom one gives it. I must bear those rules in mind.
[Richelieu has given D'Artagnan a commission as a lieutenant in the Musketeers]
It is too much! I cannot accept it. Athos, you take it.
No, for the Comte de la Fère it is too little; for Athos, too much.

[to Rochefort]
I reek of England and Calvinism.
[after seeing Athos stumble down a flight of stairs]
Athos, are you hurt?
Hurt? What I am is drunk.

[the Musketeers have captured MiLady]
As the Comte de la Fere; with the rights of high, middle and low justice, I accuse this woman of the murder of Constance de Bonacieux. How say you?
Death.
Death.

[Hesitating]
Death.
Death.
No! You have no power of justice over me! D'Artagnan! If you love me; do not let them do this!
Make one move to save her, D'Artagnan and we will cross swords; and this time, I swear I will kill you.
And two more pistoles for rowing the boat. I'm a headsman, not a sailor.
Spy... it is a foul word.
It is a familiar word to me, Eminence, in your service.

[glares at Rochefort, then]
On your knees, little man, before your master!

[of Milady]
I love her with my head. But my Constance, snatched from my side, I love with my heart.
You have a conveniently discriminating anatomy.
Leave now. Leave Paris, leave France. Get as far from that evil woman's grasp as you can.

[upon learning that a bottle of wine is poisoned]
I always had my doubts about the Anjou '22.
I have affairs to be settled.
I'm not concerned with your affairs.
I would wish it.
I'm not concerned with your wishes, Milady.

you kill Buckingham or have him killed, it's no matter to me. He's an Englishman and an enemy. But you touch one hair of D'Artagnan's head and I swear, as God is my judge, I'll break you on the wheel with my own hand.
No. Monsieur D'Artagnan has assaulted me, insulted me...

[shouts]
Since when has it been possible to insult *you*, Madame?
And he will die for it.

[produces a pistol]
Have you ever seen a woman shot in the stomach? You know me, Milady. Give me the papers the Cardinal wrote just now. I'll give you five seconds.

[a bullet shatters his wine glass]
This wine does not travel well.

[upon learning that Milady had planned to kill him]
Trust to the Cardinal to employ every diplomatic argument. At least it relieves my conscience of any doubts I may have had of assisting the French rebels.
I shall inform His Eminence.
Lady, you'll inform no one! You came here as an ambassadress, but by God, you'll *stay* here as an assassin!

[He has cornered the fleeing Milady after her murder of Constance]
You won't need a horse on the journey you're taking, Madame. I warned you, did I not?
These enemies are the enemies of France. Root them out under my protection. Wear my coat
[of arms]
. Have my love.
Eminence, what can I say?
"Yes" will be sufficient.
I - I can't.
...You're very wet.
Wet or dry, I cannot.

[to D'Artagnan]
I don't make such an offer twice in one day. But if you should survive to return to Paris, then you may see my hand stretched out to you once more. For then, you would be a very remarkable young man indeed. I would remark on it to people.

[to D'Artagnan]
Let us rescue your mistress. It's the very least one can do for a friend.
If she can stay with the Sisters
[in a convent]
while we're at La Rochelle...
I'm sure they'll learn a great deal from each other.

[to Milady about Buckingham]
The queen of France, for whom he bears love - my word on this, as sure as I love - will be dragged out and paraded in dishonor.

[He and the others are headed for the bastion at St. Rochelle for a wagered breakfast and a private talk]
Seems a long way to go for breakfast.

[From the St. Rochelle bastion to the attacking rebels]
Gentlemen! A moment please! We're having breakfast!
[He is fired at]
Barbarians! Have they no manners?
What do you want of me? There's nothing between us.
Thank God! But there might be.

[the Musketeers has just rescued him from a firing squad]
Not before time, musketeers!
Who hurries to rescue a spy? And a Cardinal's spy?

[He is face to face with Milady]
The Gascon was right... you're still beautiful.
[He advances into the light; she recognizes him]
The Comte de la Fere!
No, Milady. The Comte de la Fere is dead. You killed me years ago... out riding on a summer's day.
[Her hand strays towards the hidden brand on her left shoulder]
It's burned no deeper into you than it is into me.

[holding Milady at bay with the point of his sword after she has tried to stab him with a poisoned dagger]
Try that again and I'll cut some fleur-de-lys on the rest of you!

[to Constance after the three musketeers have dropped her off at the convent]
Don't let them get you into any dirty habits!
